text: Don't go around saying the world owes you a living. The world owes you nothing. It was here first.
author: Mark Twain

text: Thinking is the hardest work there is, which is the probable reason why so few engage in it.
author: Henry Ford

text: Nobody gets to live life backward. Look ahead — that's where your future lies.
author: Ann Landers

text: Experience is not what happens to you; it is what you do with what happens to you.
author: Aldous Huxley

text: Not everything that is faced can be changed. But nothing can be changed until it is faced.
author: James Baldwin

text: You only have to do a very few things right in your life — so long as you don't do too many things wrong.
author: Warren Buffet

text: The beautiful thing about learning is nobody can take it away from you.
author: B.B. King

text: You cannot do a kindness too soon, for you never know how soon it will be too late.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: What do we live for if it is not to make life less difficult for each other.
author: George Eliot

text: It's not necessary to take a person's advice to make him feel good — all you have to do is ask it.
author: Richard Armour

text: A man always has two reasons for doing anything — a good reason and the real reason.
author: J. Pierpont Morgan

text: I would rather sit on a pumpkin and have it all to myself, than to be crowded on a velvet cushion.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: If you want to know what God thinks of money, just look at the people he gave it to.
author: Dorothy Parker

text: The purpose of our lives is to be happy.
author: Dalai Lama

text: Never go to bed mad. Stay up and fight.
author: Phyllis Diller

text: I am only an average man, but, by George, I work harder at it than the average man.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: If you have a job without any aggravations, you don't have a job.
author: Malcolm Forbes
